lines.text:
[a bathtub is behind a door that they open]
Ohhhh, a rowboat.
A rowboat, you're crazy. That's a horse troph.
Rowboat, horse troph. In a hotel? That's a bathtub, you imbeciles. Go take a bath.
But we can't. It ain't spring yet.
Oh yes it is. See the pretty grass?

[looks toward the bathtub]
Where?

[Moe shoves him in and closes the door. Curly giggles]
You're next.
But I had a bath.
When?
July 14, 1910. I was too young to fight about it then.
What are you gonna do now?
Take a bath.

[Curly reads a telegram of their prize money and sees that taxes reduced their prise money into $4.95]
Nyaaaaa...
[faints, Larry grabs it. Reads it]
They'll put us in jail!
[faints, Moe grabs it]
Did he say jail?
No, Yale. He's got a brother in college with two heads. They got him in a bottle.
[Looks at the telegram for a second and flinches]
Is something wrong?
Nothing. The figures stagger me.
And so will your bill.

[Thinks the canopy bed is a bunk bed, steps up Moe to get to the top. Feels it]
I'll be able to sleep up here for a week, this bed is so soft. Give me a call for Wednesday.
[Lays on his back and then the bed collapses]

[Drinks a whole bottle of champagne. Followed by a faint rumbling noise]
This bottle sounds flat.
Try another.

[gets a bottle of champagne from the tray]
I'll sharpen this one up.
[Shakes it, then opens it with foam squirting out. Curly puts it in his mouth and champagne sprays out of his ears. Then stops after a while]
Boy, did I sharpen that bottle.

[picks up a glass]
A toast.

[picks up a glass]
A toast.

[picks up air]
A toast.
[Sees that there is no glass]
Roses are red, violets are blue, there's no glass for me, so hot cakes to you. Nyuk, Nyuk, Nyuk.
[Moe and Larry throw pancakes onto his face]
If you want to cheat, cheat fair.
This bed goes back to Henry the Eighth.
That's nothing. We had a bed that went back to Sears Roebuck the Third.
Roses are red, and violets are blue, try Stick-Fast glue, and you'll be stuck to, oh boy I got it, if I make the best slogan I'll win a lot of money!
Oh your crazy, you've been sending those in for weeks, nobody ever wins those.
Yeah, why don't you play cards and prove your mind? What there is of it.
See the money I get!

[putting a pancake on the center plate]
There's that chip, I call. What do ya got?

[laying down his hand]
Just four aces.

[slams his hand on the table]
And me with four kings again.

[taking the pancakes]
Well it must be beginner's luck.
I can't understand it, everyday you have beginner's luck.

[getting up to reach for the syrup]
Well its just one of those things you know...

[grabs Larry by the hair and looks on his chair and sees a lot of aces]
You want to cheat, cheat fair, anything I hate is a crookin' crook.
[Moe shakes Larry and more aces fall out of his coat]

[slaps Larry in the head and then sits down to eat the pancakes]
My beginner's luck, huh, huh, huh.

[carrying a boiling kettle]
I got it! Hot water always melts glue.
[Moe begins thrashing as Larry holds him and pours the water onto his mouth]

[angry]
What do you think I am, a lobster? Tryin' to boil me alive?

[while being slapped in the head by Moe]
Well, hot water always melts glue!
[first lines]
How many?
I'll take three.
I'll take the same.
I bet two.
[Moe puts two pancakes on the center plate]
I'll see those two, and I'll raise you five!
[Larry puts his entire stack on the center plate]
I'd better win today I haven't had breakfast in a week!
Well the best man always wins.
Well there's four... Hey I need some more chips!
[the camera moves over to Curly flipping a pancake in a frying pan]
Hurry it up with those chips!
[Curly comes over to the table]
I'm getting sick and tired of making chips for you guys, I gotta get busy for my radio contest!
